pros:
Amazing learning experience
Global exposure
Great opportunity to solve complex & interesting problems
Work with really intelligent people
cons:
GE has an elitist culture. It's part of the reason for their current turmoil. They promote and encourage employees that they believe are from high society or higher socio-economic backgrounds. Those employees run the company, everyone else works for those employees. They are only open to ideas that come from those elite select employees. They usually only hire people into their early development leadership programs (for candidates straight out of elite universities) and then groom a select few from there. This elitist hierarchy is what causes the financial decline they currently face. It creates an environment that encourages illusion and discourages honest decision-making. All of this makes it quite difficult for people of color to grow and succeed, unless of course they too are from an elite socio-economic background.

Finally, there are a lot of layoffs. It's nerve-wracking to work there, never knowing which department they will completely dissolve next.

job_title: Senior Software Engineer in New Orleans, LA
pros: Working in the GE New Orleans office was lovely. It was the easiest job I've ever had. The people were nice, we had permissive leave so I took roughly 5 weeks vacation per year and never heard any complaints from the management. It was super corporate, but I attribute that as the reason why they could pamper us so well.
cons: They closed the office as a whole and laid off the 100 or so employees. This was a result of the long term effects of Covid-19. That said, GE does have a very real philosophy of looking at the numbers and cutting costs in any way possible, even if it's heartless and short sighted. I realize this is standard for any company this large, but as a result of it, any long term employee there is well aware that they need to shift their position regularly to match whatever is the most profitable side of the business at the time. The only thing you can count on at GE is CHANGE.
